result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J Stewart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas J Stewart is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Thomas J Stewart was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas J Stewart

Minutes:  15CM1005/15CM1470.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Timothy Baldwin.  Cases are resolved.  

15CM1005 - deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Deft fined $100 plus costs.  Bond to apply.  Balance to be returned to poster.  Count 2 is dismissed on State's motion.  DNA ordered; written notice given to deft.

15CM1470 - case dismissed on State's motion.  Bond to be returned to poster.

Minutes:  NO RECORD TAKEN due to jury trial.  15CM1470/15CM1005.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Atty Timothy Baldwin appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft presently incarcerated in Milw; probation was revoked.  Defense counsel reports the cases are resolved.  Plea hrg 2/17/17 @ 10am.  State will prepare writ.

*Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No drug paraphernalia.

Defendant requests Jury Trial.   Final pre-trial scheduled for February 8, 2017 at 10:10 am.  Jury selection scheduled for February 27, 2017 at 09:00 am.  $1000  Cash Bond Continued as previously set.    jk
DE in custody and appearing today at 1pm Intake.

Clerk Lehman returned the call to the deft - told him that he needs to contact his atty to schedule voluntary appearance.  Deft reports his atty told him to just show up at the courthouse to get his warrant cancelled.  Clerk Lehman told him that a voluntary appearance needs to be scheduled thru his atty
received from deft - showed up last week & this week to cancel his warrant but the courtroom was closed.
Of bail/bond forf.
received via fax @ 12:30pm from Atty Baldwin that the deft is not appearing today and requesting to appear via telephone

Minutes:  15CM1005/15CM1470.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  No appearance by deft nor Atty Baldwin.  The court received a fax @ 12:30pm today from Atty Baldin (hrg scheduled for 1:15pm) which stated the deft was refusing to come to court today.  Deft wasn't going to appear until he took care of his warrant from Milw. County.  Based on deft's non-appearance, a bench warrant is authorized in each case; cash bond of $1,000 on each file.  Prior bonds are forfeited.  Court will address Atty Baldwin's non-appearance at a future hrg when he is present.
docs from defense counsel re: deft's hospitalization
documentation received around 11:15am today which indicates the deft may be in a (4) week program.  Per Court, ok to reschedule.  Email sent to attys with next court date.
Final pre-trial on November 21, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on September 26, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Minutes:  15CM1005/15CM1470.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Atty Timothy Baldwin appeared on behalf of deft.  No appearance by deft.  Atty Baldwin reports his client is still hospitalized in a drug treatment program; however, he has not received any supporting documentation from the deft's family.  Court sets case over to 9/26/16 @ 2:30pm.  If the deft is not hospitalized, he is required to appear.  Otherwise, supporting documentation needs to be received or the court will issue a warrant
To Clerk from Timothy Baldwin

Minutes:  15CM1005/15CM1470.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Atty Timothy Baldwin appeared on behalf of deft.  Court notes the deft's non appearance for today's hrg.  Atty Baldwin reports the deft voluntarily entered into a drug treatment program.  Court reserves the right to issue a warrant at a later time.  JS to remain on for 9/19/16 @ 9am.

FPT 9/1/16 @ 1:30pm, JS 9/19/16 @ 9am on both cases.

Deft called this morning requesting to reschedule his hrg; he states he is at school in Illinois and forgot about this court date.  Clerk Lehman informed him that it could not get rescheduled due to the lateness of the call.
